intro: Borzicactus intertextus var. celendinensis, commonly known as the Celendín cactus, is a rare and striking plant native to the Andes mountains of Peru. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are covered in dense, white spines, which provide protection from herbivores and intense sunlight. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the warmer months, adding a striking visual contrast to its spiny form. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it well-suited for arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
